Articles.Content:
Hi

I recently found this on steam (few weeks ago) grabbed the demo, and within a day or two I had made my first landing on the mun, many failed attempts later

I purchased the game after wiping away my (man) tears of joy upon landing (sideways) onto the munar surface.

Great concept you guys have had with this little gem, looking forward to the new update (.20) as my laptop is struggling a bit with the current version!

Good luck to you all

GodBlock

Hello and welcome to the forums, one of the nicest places on the tinterweb.

Good to hear your enjoying the game, unfortunately the new update probably wont bring optimization with it but you never know.

My first Mun mission was a bit of a disaster, I knocked over my lander when I got to the Mun leaving Jeb in need of a rescue, then the rescue mission ran out of fuel on the way back so needed to rescue that as well....... but that's KSP for you

Good luck in your future missions and never be afraid to ask for help, as people go above and beyond on here to help others.

G.

Welcome fellow Kerbinaught! Now go dock up a giant space station

unfortunately the new update probably wont bring optimization with it but you never know

Actually Gniuz, it will. from what they said it will bring around 40% RAM usage improvement! and that's just rad!

Cheers!

Welcome to the forums!

I still remember the first time I put a lander on the Mun. I was absolutely thrilled I could accomplish something that difficult (at the time).

If you ever get stuck somewhere or just want to sharpen your skills, stop by the tutorial section, and particularly the Drawing Board (link in my sig). There might be a tutorial there that has just what you're looking for. You can also ask the fine people in the How To section any questions about what you're trying to accomplish, and they'll be more than happy to answer.

Happy landings!
